## Recommended Git Workflow

Our recommended Git/Github developer workflow is as follows:

- Create a development branch
- `usethis::use_version(x.x.x.9000)` or update DESCRIPTION
- `git add -A`, `git commit -m`, `git push origin dev-branch`, 
- Submit pull request
- Get changes reviewed
- Once changes are approved, the maintainer decides on version major/minor/patch version increment â€“ how to attach tag at this point? Ask developer to commit again with decided version and tag?
- Merge to main branch

Graphically, this looks as follows:

```{mermaid}
flowchart TB
    mb["Main Branch"]
    cdb["Development Branch"]
    ca["Changes added"]
    cc["Changes committed"]
    cp["Changes pushed"]
    cr{Code Review}
    vi[Version incremented]

    mb --"git checkout -b dev-branch" --> cdb
    cdb --"git add -A" --> ca
    ca --"git commit -m 'commit message'" --> cc
    cc --"git push origin dev-branch" --> cp
    cp --"Github: Make Pull Request"--> cr
    cr --"Accept changes"--> vi
    vi --> mb
    cr --"Reject changes"--> cdb

```
